My guess at this point would be an error in the maths that updates the
position from the force beign appied to the joint, momentum and
gravity. Some other thoughts:

 - Are you sure the arm jointt force is strong enough (relative to the
gravity) to move the arm. Did you drop a decimal place somewhere.
 - I don't think you need to scale to degrees and then back to [-1,1].
That is just the same as scaling directly from radians to [-1,1],
unless I've misunderstood. Also the input scale doesn't have to match
the scaling applied to the outputs, you can pick completely different
scalings and units for the outputs, it makes no difference because the
weights in the neural net will evolve to whatevever scalings you use.

Colin
